pullRequest.body:
In this PR, given a Grothendieck topology `J` on a category `C`, we define a type `J.OneHypercoverFamily` of families of 1-hypercovers. When `H : J.OneHypercoverFamily`, we define a predicate `H.IsGenerating` which means that any covering sieve contains the sieve generated by the underlying covering of one of the 1-hypercovers in the family. If this holds, we show in `OneHypercoverFamily.isSheaf_iff` that a presheaf `P : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ A` is a sheaf iff for any 1-hypercover `E` in the family, the multifork `E.multifork P` is limit.

---

nodes.body:
Thanks Joël and Dagur!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9377604406/job/25819443219)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9377604406/job/25819443497)
I suggest removing the lemma `ofArrows.exists` which you only use once, and the proof is shorter without using it. Otherwise LGTM

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hk : ∀ b, k (I.fstTo b) ≫ I.fst b = k (I.sndTo b) ≫ I.snd b) : ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hk : ∀ b, k (I.fstTo b) ≫ I.fst b = k (I.sndTo b) ≫ I.snd b) (a : I.L): ```

```suggestion
  cases hb with
  | mk i => 
    rw [assoc, ← P.map_comp, ← op_comp, ← fac,
      op_comp, P.map_comp, fac'_assoc]
    exact F.condition
      { h₁ := le _ (Sieve.ofArrows_mk _ _ _)
        h₂ := hf
        w := fac }
```

Usually, I would use `obtain ⟨i⟩ := hb`, but this occasionnaly make certain variable names unreachable (here `Y` becomes `Y✝`), which was the reason for the `ofArrows.exists` lemma. I am happy to see that `cases` does not have this problem. Here, I have used the syntax `cases' hb with i`.

```suggestion
theorem ofArrows_pUnit : (ofArrows _ fun _ : PUnit => f) = singleton f := by
```

```suggestion
/-- Condition that a topology is generated by the 1-hypercovers of size `w`. -/
```
In my understanding of the English language, I would not add `the` here.
Doesn't it mean that it's generated by *all* the 1-hypercovers?
Yes, `IsGeneratedByOneHypercovers` means it is generated by *all the* 1-hypercovers.
This is why I suggest adding "the". But I'm not a native English speaker, and in any case it's not that important.
